questions.question: We often ………………….. over the fields in the evening.
According to the time table, the train …………………… at
questions.description: The simple present is commonly used to talk about time-tabled events.

questions.question: My dog …………………. everything. He is almost human.
We went out although it …………………….. a bit late.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, the verb in the subordinate clause too will be in the past tense.

questions.question: My feet were sore because my shoes …………………. badly.
questions.description: Fit and fitted are both possible here.

questions.question: I ……………………. my job because I was ill for six months.
questions.description: The simple past is the most common tense for talking about finished events.

questions.question: During the holidays, I ………………….. a lot of reading.
We ………………….. to Paris for the weekend.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about a future event when the arrangement already exists.

questions.question: She …………………………. to anyone.
questions.description: The present perfect is common with never and ever.

questions.question: You never ……………………… me finish a sentence.
I …………………….. cooking or cleaning.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about likes, dislikes etc.

questions.question: It ……………………… a long time since we met.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to indicate that an action or situation started in the past and has continued up to the present.
